nodes.bodyText: Common case (of aggr/group-by) should be first?
Done
Same here, common case first?
Done
Seems this class does not implement any of the methods?

Yes, currently DISTINCT keyword is not supported in the PinotQuery, so we use aggregation to pass the arguments. We keep it the same way for backward-compatibility, and I have added a TODO to clean it up later.
Why not use Preconditions.checkState()? Are we moving away from them as a convention?
assert has no performance impact on production code. We don't really need to check it, this is more for readability

You can probably stash away the order by presence in a boolean instance variable and avoid the method call to getOrderByExpressions() here since I believe it will be called by each combine thread for each segment it is processing in a loop. Simply check for the instance variable
Done
please consider separating this into multiple private methods for better readability
Done
javadoc please
javadoc please
Please add javadocs to all classes
Can we add another 2 similar tests for single and multi column distinct on dictionary encoded columns. Here both the tests are on raw columns (and so we use DistinctTable)
DistinctQueriesTest has all the scenarios covered
We should separate this into multiple individual unit tests.
Split into testSingleColumnDistinctOnlyInnerSegment and testSingleColumnDistinctOrderByInnerSegment. I don't think we need to split further because that is not as easy to manage
Unrelated to this PR - Can we please add another version of tests for SQL? Or may be just use getBrokerResponseForSqlQuery() instead of both PQL and SQL?
Why do we need that? On the server side, PQL and SQL are handled the same way, and we can use the same test logic for both
